mods.abstract: TWENTY DOLLARS REWARD--Ranaway from the subscriber, on the 12th of May last, a mulatto BOY. By the name of Bouke, about 15 years old, stout built. He had on, when he left, a blue blanket coat and wool hat. There are two bald places on his head, occasioned by a burn when a child. He has also a scar on his forehead; he is four feet six inches high; wears a hand-kerchief on his head to prevent detection. Whoever will ar-rest said boy, or lodge him in jail, and give information to M.J. Reigart, 16 Carondelet street, will receive the above re-ward. [o22 3m] ROBERT McALPIN.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
